dcterms:description: The anbn network represented in Fig. 3 outputs the correct probability for each character, for each sequence in the anbn language, with a margin of error below 10−6.
dcterms:title: anbn

dcterms:description: The network represented in Fig. 4 outputs the correct probability for each character, for each sequence in the anbncn language, with a margin of error below 10−6.
dcterms:title: anbncn

dcterms:description: The network represented in Fig. 5 outputs the correct probability for each character, for each sequence in the anbncndn language, with a margin of error below 10−6.
dcterms:title: anbncndn

dcterms:description: The network represented in Fig. 6 outputs the correct probability for each character, for each sequence in the anb2n language, with a margin of error below 10−6.
dcterms:title: anb2n

dcterms:description: The network represented in Fig. 6 outputs the correct probability for each character, for each sequence in the anbmcn+m language, with a margin of error below .2 (and below 10−4 for deterministic steps, i.e., probabilities 0 or 1).
dcterms:title: anbmcn+m

dcterms:description: When brackets are well balanced, the Dyck-1 network in Fig. 7 correctly predicts that no closing bracket can follow by assigning it probability 0.
dcterms:title: Dyck-1

dcterms:description: When brackets are well balanced, the Dyck-1 network in Fig. 7 correctly predicts that no closing bracket can follow by assigning it probability 0.
dcterms:title: Dyck-2

dcterms:description: For the net in Fig. 9, the output unit at time step i is the ith digit of the sum of the inputs.
dcterms:title: Binary Addition
